question: Which of the following Mughal emperors granted permission to Britishers to trade free of tax in the territories of Bengal, Hyderabad, and Gujarat?
explanation: Farruksiyar who was the nephew of Jahandar Shah was the ruler of the Mughal Empire who ruled from 1713 CE to 1719 CE. He granted permission to trade free of tax in the territories of Bengal, Hyderabad, and Gujarat to the Britishers.
